Package src.model.ai

Class EasyAIPlayer

java.lang.Object
src.model.ai.EasyAIPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Player
public class EasyAIPlayer extends Object implements Player
The EasyAIPlayer class implements a simple AI player for the Quarto game. This AI uses basic strategies to select pawns and play moves. It aims to either win or block the opponent from winning if a winning move is detected.

This class provides methods to:

  • Check if a list of pawns is complete
  • Check if a list of pawns has potential to form a winning line
  • Update characteristics based on the pawns
  • Calculate characteristics from the game grid
  • Calculate scores for available pawns
  • Select a pawn to play
  • Play a shot in the game

This implementation uses randomization for pawn selection when multiple options are equally good. It also evaluates the game grid to find optimal positions for placing pawns.

See Also:
QuartoModel, QuartoPawn, QuartoWin

    EasyAIPlayer()
    Constructs an EasyAIPlayer with a new random number generator and a new instance of QuartoWin.

  • Constructor Details

    • EasyAIPlayer

      public EasyAIPlayer()

  • Method Details

    • isCompleteList

      public boolean isCompleteList​(QuartoPawn[] pawns)
      Checks if a list of pawns is complete. A list is considered complete if it contains exactly 4 QuartoPawn objects and none of them are null.
      Parameters:
      pawns - the array of QuartoPawn objects to check.
      Returns:
      true if the list contains exactly 4 non-null QuartoPawn objects, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the list does not contain exactly 4 QuartoPawn objects.

    • hasPotentialList

      public boolean hasPotentialList​(QuartoPawn[] pawns)
      Checks if a list of pawns has the potential to form a winning line. A list is considered to have potential if it is not complete and all non-null pawns in the list share at least one characteristic.
      Parameters:
      pawns - the array of QuartoPawn objects to check.
      Returns:
      true if the list has potential, false otherwise.

    • updateCharacteristics

      public void updateCharacteristics​(int[] characteristics, QuartoPawn[] pawns)
      Updates the characteristics array based on the given list of pawns. Each characteristic count is incremented based on the pawns' characteristics.
      Parameters:
      characteristics - the array to be updated with characteristic counts.
      pawns - the array of QuartoPawn objects to check.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the size of the characteristics array is not 8 or if the size of the pawns array is not 4.

    • calculateCharacteristicsFromGrid

      public int[] calculateCharacteristicsFromGrid​(QuartoPawn[][] grid)
      Calculates the characteristic counts for each row, column, and diagonal in the game grid. The counts are updated only for incomplete lines that have potential to form a winning line.
      Parameters:
      grid - the 2D array representing the game grid.
      Returns:
      an array of characteristic counts.

    • calculateAvailablePawnsScores

      public int[] calculateAvailablePawnsScores​(QuartoModel quartoModel)
      Calculates the scores for each available pawn based on the current game state.
      Parameters:
      quartoModel - the current game model containing the state of the game.
      Returns:
      an array of scores for each available pawn.

    • selectPawn

      public void selectPawn​(QuartoModel quartoModel)
      Selects a pawn for the player based on the scores calculated for available pawns.
      Specified by:
      selectPawn in interface Player
      Parameters:
      quartoModel - the current game model containing the state of the game.
